discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SG p 28: reference zones only in FW policy; if you want to reference an individual member/interface, you create a separate zone with only that interface as sole member

Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Two hub-and-spoke groups are connected through a site-to-site IPsec VPN between Hub 1 and Hub 2.
Which two configuration settings are required for Toronto and London spokes to establish an ADVPN shortcut? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
(pag 269 Sd WAN Study guide for fortios-72)
C. On the spokes, auto-discovery-receiver must be enabled on the IPsec VPN to the hub.
D. On the hubs, auto-discovery-sender must be enabled on the IPsec VPNs to spokes.

Selected Answer: CD
A: incorrect, net device is only enabled on overlays configured as dial up.
B: incorrect, auto discovery forwarder is used on the hub to communicate with other hubs, it does not need to be enabled on all spokes.
C: correct, receiver is enabled on the spokes
D: correct sender is enabled on the hub 

Page 270
This question is asking about the configuration of auto-discovery 
it is important to understand the difference between receiver, sender and forwarder.

Selected Answer: CD
CD
auto-disovery-forwarder only between hubs

CD are correct, Refer to AD VPN section

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.


Exhibit A -

//IMG//



Exhibit B -

//IMG//


Exhibit A shows the configuration for an SD-WAN rule and exhibit B shows the respective rule status, the routing table, and the member status.

The administrator wants to understand the expected behavior for traffic matching the SD-WAN rule.

Based on the exhibits, what can the administrator expect for traffic matching the SD-WAN rule?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When you use "set gateway enable" in a FortiGate SD-WAN member configuration, it bypasses the usual FIB lookup process. Instead of relying on the forwarding information base to determine the next-hop based on the destination IP, the device uses the explicitly configured gateway address from the SD-WAN member settings. This provides more predictable routing behavior and ensures that traffic is directed through the intended gateway, regardless of what the routing table might otherwise dictate

Selected Answer: D
Services rule 1 set gateway enable, : this instructs Fortigate to skip the FIB lookup, and instead use the gateway address that you configured in the SD-WAN member settings ( PAG 173 7.2)

Selected Answer: B
Routing for 10.0.0.0/8 is using T_INET_1_0 and T_INET_0_0.
SLA shows that T_INET_1_0 has SLA0x1 which is better than SLA0x0 fot T_INET_0_0

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

comments.content:
Hit submit too soon.
Except for the fact that member 5 does not have a route to the destination which is a requirement. Thus the next best member is 4. Thus T_INET_1_0 gets all traffic matching the rule.
B is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
SD-WAN strategy is Lowest Cost (SLA) due to the "set mode sla" command. 
SG p226-228: member 5 meets both SLA targets; member 4 meets only one of the SLA targets, and member 3 meets neither SLA target. On that basis, member 5 (T_MPLS_0) will get all traffic matching the "Corp" SD-WAN rule.

Selected Answer: B
T_MPLS is the best member (it matches more sla), but there's no route to destination 10.0.0.0/8. Therefore, the next member that meet sla requirement and have a route for the destination is selected (T_INET_1_0)

choices.C: The traffic will be routed over T_INET_0_0.
choices.A: The traffic will be load balanced across all three overlays.
choices.D: The traffic will be routed over T_MPLS_0.
choices.B: The traffic will be routed over T_INET_1_0.

choices.D: Provide direct internet access on spokes.
choices.A: Provide internet access through the hub.
choices.B: Centralize security inspection on the hub.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A & B
Remote internet access (RIA) = through the Hub

Selected Answer: AB
RIA is where internet passes through the hub. SD-WAN can use RIA to steer traffic through overlays to centralize traffic on the hub for inspection and improved performance if DIA is poor or unavailable.
A: Correct
B:Correct
C: Incorrect, it can but spokes could be using DIA and have adequate inspection already.
D: incorrect, this would be DIA (direct internet access)
P. 12 Study Guide

Selected Answer: AB
A. Provide internet access through the hub.
B. Centralize security inspection on the hub.
pag 13 guide 7.2

Selected Answer: AB
AB are correct
A y B son correctas
